meanings.definition: A soft greasy substance used for waterproofing leather.
meanings.sent1: I applied dubbins to my boots to protect them from the rain.
meanings.sent2: The shoemaker used dubbins to make the leather water-resistant.
meanings.sent3: The dubbins made the leather so slick that the shoes slid off the table!
meanings.sent4: Her hands felt like dubbins, smooth and oily after working with the leather conditioner.
meanings.sent5: The smell of dubbins filled the room, reminding me of the old cobbler shop.

meanings.sent1: I dubbinsed the new belt to make it last longer.
meanings.sent2: She dubbinses the saddle regularly to keep it in good condition.
meanings.sent3: He dubbinsed the leather jacket so well, it looked brand new!
meanings.sent4: The cobbler dubbinsed the shoes with care, ensuring they were well protected.
meanings.sent5: Dubbinsing the gloves made them supple and ready for use in the cold.

meanings.sent1: I have a jar full of dubbins for treating leather goods.
meanings.sent2: The box contained various dubbins for different types of leather.
meanings.sent3: The dubbins on the shelf gleamed in the sunlight, tempting me to start a new project.
meanings.sent4: She collected dubbins from around the world, each with a unique scent.
meanings.sent5: The dubbins in the container were a treasure trove for leatherworkers.
